name: Rajan Vaish
title: Postdoctoral Researcher at Stanford University
summary: I do HCI, crowdsourcing, education, social and mobile computing to understand aspects associated with mobilizing the citizen crowd. I believe that by harnessing the power of citizen crowd we can achieve bigger goals which were't possible a couple of years ago. I am also interested in entrepreneurship, and passionate about ICTD research/issues.

groups.name: U.S. Government Relations, Lobbying and Public Affairs (Lobbyist - Lobbyists)

Primarily, I worked on Twitch Crowdsourcing project: www.twitch.stanford.edu; and continuing collaboration on the Crowd Research initiative: crowdresearch.stanford.edu, aspiringresearchers.soe.ucsc.edu.

past_companies.title: Intern
past_companies.description: I interned for OLPC, during summer break of 2008 and worked on a Geography Teaching Tool, using QGIS, MapServer, OpenLayers & GeoRSS. The project won 1st prize at the 1st International Conference on Contemporary Computing at Noida, co-organized by the University of Florida.
